sub_concepts.name: Magma chamber
sub_concepts.definition: A large underground reservoir of molten rock that feeds a volcano.

sub_concepts.name: Volcanic arc
sub_concepts.definition: A chain of volcanoes that forms when an oceanic plate is being subducted beneath a continental plate.

sub_concepts.name: Shield volcano
sub_concepts.definition: A type of volcano that has a broad, gently sloping shape and is typically formed by the eruption of fluid lava flows.

sub_concepts.name: Stratovolcano
sub_concepts.definition: A tall, conical volcano composed of alternating layers of lava, tephra, and other pyroclastic material.

sub_concepts.name: Cinder cone
sub_concepts.definition: A small, steep-sided volcano that is formed by the accumulation of ash and cinder from small-scale eruptions.

sub_concepts.name: Caldera
sub_concepts.definition: A large depression in the Earth's surface that forms when a magma chamber collapses or is drained.
